name: Wasara coffee cup
description:
89mm（with incl grip 107mm）x60mm, 150ml Packs of 6 or 100 These Japanese designed single-use cups are stunning and eco-friendly. Made from a composite of 100% renewable, tree-free materials: bamboo, reed and sugarcane waste, its delicately dimpled and curved plates and bowls, and green-credentials won me over. All Wasara products are biodegradable and can be composted, dug into your garden or put in your worm bin. You can use Wasara for hot or cold food and they won't lose shape, even after hours of use. I wrote a blog post a few years ago about some of the eco disposable plates that are available, here's what I said... If you're after a whole set for that special dinner party, I've put together a dinner party pack.

Check out the full Wasara range that's available on the So D'lish shop.

name: Cakesnake - the ulitmate bakeware organiser
description:
Designed by a Sydney mum and made by her product designer husband, the Cakesnake solved her problem of her bakeware tumbling onto the floor every time she wanted something.

The Cakesnake is made from aluminium and powder coated in white or red. Use your Cakesnake to hold your bakeware, platters, chopping boards or cookbooks.

Length: 47cm
Height: 15cm
Depth: 33cm
Props not included

name: Full sari apron
description: I love that each of these sari aprons are unique. They are made from good quality, upcycled saris and sewn by women in India who otherwise may not have had work. The aprons are made from cotton and are nice and soft and because they are made from used saris, you don't need to be too careful with them... just pop them in the washing machine when they get too dirty. Half sari aprons are also available

name: Wasara Maru plates - stylish disposable tableware
description: Small: 9cm Medium: 16.5cm Large: 23cm These Japanese designed single-use plates are stunning and eco-friendly. Made from a composite of 100% renewable, tree-free materials: bamboo, reed and sugarcane waste, its delicately dimpled and curved plates and bowls, and green-credentials won me over. All Wasara products are biodegradable and can be composted, dug into your garden or put in your worm bin. You can use Wasara for hot or cold food and they won't lose shape, even after hours of use. I wrote a blog post a few years ago about some of the eco disposable plates that are available, here's what I said... The Maru plates come in small (12 or 200 per pack), medium and large (6 or 100 per pack) sizes. If you're after a whole set for that special dinner party, I've put together a dinner party pack.

name: Wasara Nagakaku rectangle plate
description: The Nagakaku plate comes in packs of 6 or 100 and are 29 x 9cm. This plate would be great for canapes (pair it up with some bamboo skewers), entrees, small shared plates, or even a trio of desserts. Wasara products are designed in Japan as single-use, stunning and eco-friendly tableware. Made from a composite of 100% renewable, tree-free materials: bamboo, reed and sugarcane waste, its delicately dimpled and curved plates and bowls, and green-credentials won me over. All Wasara products are biodegradable and can be composted, dug into your garden or put in your worm bin. You can use Wasara for hot or cold food and they won't lose shape, even after hours of use. I've used this plate as pictured or upside down, which is equally as beautiful. I wrote a blog post a few years ago about some of the eco disposable plates that are available, here's what I said... The Nagakaku plates are a perfect accompaniment to the Wasara dinner party set that I've collated.

name: Wasara dinner party set - stylish disposable tableware
description: Up to $10 off the individual price. These Japanese designed single-use plates are stunning and eco-friendly. Made from a composite of 100% renewable, tree-free materials: bamboo, reed and sugarcane waste, its delicately dimpled and curved plates and bowls, and green-credentials won me over. All Wasara products are biodegradable and can be composted, dug into your garden or put in your worm bin. You can use Wasara for hot or cold food and they won't lose shape, even after hours of use. I wrote a blog post a few years ago about some of the eco disposable plates that are available, here's what I said... Each dinner party pack comes with: * 6 Maru or Kaku large plates * 6 Maru or Kaku medium plates * 6 Bowls or Compotes * 6 Tumblers or coffee cups * 12 Knives, forks and spoons Is there a dinner party combination that you'd like to see in the shop? Let me know and I'll add it for you. :) The Nagakaku plates are a perfect accompaniment to any of the Wasara dinner sets.

name: Wooden disposable boats
description:
Baby boats: 8 x 5.5 x 1.5 cm
Mini boats: 11 x 5.5 x 1.5 cm
Small boats: 14 x 8 x 2.5 cm
Medium boats: 17 x 9 x 2.5 cm
Large boats: 22.5 x 11 x 3 cm

Made from white pine, these cute wooden boats come in a variety of sizes that would be great for handing out food samples at a trade fair or holding nibbles at a cocktail function or party.

Available in packs of 10 or 100.

name: Wasara cutlery
description: These Japanese designed single-use knives, forks and spoons are stunning and eco-friendly. Made from bamboo, all Wasara products are biodegradable and can be composted. Each piece has a clever little notch on it, which has been designed to hook on to your Wasara plates and bowls. The cutlery range is available in a pack containing 6 knives, forks and spoons. Or buy them separately in packs of 50 or 250. If you're after a whole set for that special dinner party, I've put together a dinner party pack.

name: Bamboo skewers
description: Twist top skewer: 12 cm Cocktail fork: 8 cm Musubi skewer: 9 cm - best seller Fancy-up your canapés with some skewers!
